scenario:
The S&P 500 Index gained 24% in 2024, while Berkshire Hathaway's performance varied depending on the share class. Over the last two years, the broader market is up 53%, with Berkshire Hathaway trailing the market. However, the author believes Berkshire Hathaway will outperform the S&P 500 in 2025 due to its more balanced portfolio and ability to hedge inflation.

Berkshire Hathaway's equities portfolio is now more diversified, with Apple making up only 25% of the portfolio after being trimmed by 67%. The company holds a mix of consumer goods, financials, and energy stocks, including Kraft Heinz, Sirius XM, and Citigroup. Berkshire Hathaway also has a massive cash hoard exceeding $300 billion and has only repurchased a few billion dollars' worth of its own stock this year.

The author believes the market is vulnerable due to its high concentration in the Fateful Eight stocks, including Apple, which may be more susceptible to pullbacks on earnings hiccups or issues with the broader market and inflation. Berkshire Hathaway's energy assets and stocks, including Chevron and Occidental Petroleum, provide a hedge against inflation.

Berkshire Hathaway's management team has navigated many recessions and bear markets and has a knack for getting out at the right time. The company's massive cash position offers flexibility, and its diversified portfolio positions it well to outperform the broader market in 2025.
